Reviews.Title: “Dirty, unsanitary and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Pj_CP_12
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! Was disgusted by the hotel conditions... Smelled of smoke, stained linens and feminine products in the hallways were only some of our experiences...

Reviews.Title: “Ok to stay but don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: NYforEVER_12
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the shuttle , the shuttle driver was from Chicago and we (( me and my friend )) had to listen to him all the way from luv field to the hotel ... At the fourth day we decided to go to buffalo wings in Dallas down town , we got in the van and then I was really shocked we he got a call he said well I wanna go to CVS with a another person then I can take us after or whenever he gets back We felt like we're a second degree citizen , at the last day a other shuttle driver he had to stop at the stop sign but he pull out without paying attention of a car getting so close to us ... That was awful ... 2ndly the front desk she was very helpfull I asked for a microwave and small fridge , that was so fast and honestly free , location : was rite in front of high was or one of the busiest highways ... Stores and rest. Near by : found an Italian rest. One min. Away , store around 4 mins walking ... Indoor rest . I had a meal I felt sick for 1 day vomitting and etc. I had to eat out side thou . House keeping : was okay can't complain ... And finally my mattress was broken so I cldn't sleep on no.

Reviews.Title: “Booked here with a wedding block”
Reviews.Author: budgetgirl85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a wedding block. We stayed 3 nights. It was noted immediately that our room was HOT. We thought it was just the sun shining on the building and sucked it up. However, the next day when we were in the room for a longer amount of time we realized our air wasn't working properly. We got prompt response from the front desk and our maintenance man Jose was SO nice and professional. Once they realized the fix wasn't simple, they moved our room and threw in a complimentary breakfast for our inconvience. The hotel has Sleep Number beds. Maybe we weren't using them correctly, but we found them to be UNCOMFORTABLE. We'd start at one number going to bed and wake up at another. The darkening shades were AMAZING, kept the sunlight out when needed. Overall a good stay, within walking distance of a nice shopping center (Mockingbird Station).

Reviews.Title: “What a warm welcome and friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: CoastalVoyage
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dallas Radisson Central for three nights and the friendlyness of Texas here is really honoured daily. With excellent service, perfect dining advice, clean rooms and comfortable beds. Pillows on the bed, 2 small and 2 large and individually adjustable matresses by some magic electronic device makes one want to sleep earlier as planned. Asking for a breakfast cafe where you can have a broad variety of morning stuff the recommendation was perfect. Though the hotel American breakfast buffet for around 12 USD was also rich, succulant with strawberries, grapefruite slices, pineaplle pieces and 4 different melons, all nicely arranged and cut into just-in-the-mouth-pieces. Everything works for the benefit of the guests. Most motivated staff with no exemption. Will never stay anywhere else in Dallas near midtown and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Dallas!!! 4 miles from Downtown”
Reviews.Author: aaucello
Reviews.Content: Being only 4 miles away from downtown Dallas (right off of route 75), The Radisson Hotel Dallas Central-University Park was situated in a much better location than our original hotel was, so getting to and from the city was a breeze. After parking at the hotel (which is free by the way) and entering, we loved the marble and spacious lobby of the hotel. There is a also a very large hotel lobby bar/restaurant area with plenty of tables and comfy lounge chairs. At check-in, the lady at front desk saw that I had elite status with Club Carlson and told us she had upgraded our room. After entering the room, it did not seem like it was upgraded; I was thinking we'd be upgraded to a suite, but it was still a standard room on a high floor with two queen size beds that we'd originally booked (maybe a high floor is an upgrade? She didn't exactly specify). Either way, I was very impressed with the room. As you can see from the pictures below, the decor is more exquisite than a standard hotel room, garnished with a warm, rich, color palette and topped with some elegant touches (I loved the desk chairs). After spending a few hours exploring downtown Dallas with a good friend of mine that recently moved from NJ to Dallas for work, we decided to call it an early night because we were exhausted from all of the driving. We had a good night's sleep and were happy that the our room was very quiet and comfortable. We had two queen sized Sleep Number beds with super fluffy pillows and a soft duvet. The bathroom and sink area were very spacious. I loved that they had a magnifying mirror, which was perfect for applying makeup! The shower was basic, but clean, with plenty of hot water. The bath toiletries in the room were Radisson's signature Asira line of products. The coffee machine was located on a separate nook (with a refrigerator underneath). I really liked the pizazz decor of the room. This corner desk was big enough to comfortably work. Be sure to check out my full review (including pictures) here on my blog: http://www.justanotherpointstraveler.com/2012/01/hotel-review-radisson-hotel-dallas.html

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: WylieDave
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and I had the opportunity to stay for one evening at the Radisson Hotel Dallas Central - University Park on December 27 and 28, 2011. We stayed as part of Radisson's "Big Night Giveaway" in order to earn 50,000 bonus Club Carlson points. Since we joined Club Carlson through a special online page, we also earned 2,000 bonus points, and we earned 1,000 bonus points for making the reservation online through the Radisson booking site. Check-in was prompt, friendly, and efficient. As a Club Carlson Gold Elite member, I had requested early check-in and was granted a 1:30 PM check-in time. We were given keys to room 825. Many previous reviewers have indicated that this property is older and in need of refurbishment, and several have gone so far as to indicate that it is a lower-quality hotel not worth the cost of the room. While they are entitled to their opinions, I am going on the record to state that the property, while long-established in the heart of University Park, is glowing with modern conveniences and warm, inviting staff who spring at the opportunity to ensure that your stay is nothing but excellent. Radisson has a "you will be satisfied with your stay or you won't pay" guarantee, so please mention any perceived shortcomings to the staff and let them assist in making your stay comfortable. Our room was spacious and quite clean. The Select Comfort beds were comfortable and the sheets were crisp and pristine. Our view was of the very busy Central Expressway / Highway 75 and of the SMU campus; however, despite being practically adjacent to Central Expressway, we heard very little of the traffic noise. We also were able to watch the DART light rail on its approach to and departure from the nearby Mockingbird station, a transit point for the DART blue and red lines and access to downtown Dallas and Fort Worth (via the TRE). There were also other room amenities, including a super-comfortable easy chair and ottoman, a large work desk and desk chair, and free WiFi. The hotel is doing its part to protect the environment, and fluorescent fixtures are prevalent throughout the room and building. The bathroom was stocked with Radisson's own Asira brand of bath products; the towels were thick, fluffy, and spotlessly white. Gloriously hot water was instantly available throughout the day and evening. Additional room amenities include a large flat-screen TV, a by-the-cup Cuisinart coffee maker, and a clock radio that will also play CD's. We were offered the nightly turn down service, and were given a large envelope of sweets as a goodnight gift. The Radisson has a large bar that offers happy hour specials and a restaurant that has a renowned breakfast buffet for $11.95 per person. There are various large meeting rooms to accommodate conferences or other meetings, and a business center offering free computer access, faxing out, and printing is present in the hotel lobby. The pool was one of the things that drew us to this property, and I am happy to report that we did not have any negative issues at all with it. The water was clean and clear and, most importantly, warm. The pool has an interesting indoor/outdoor feature, but since the outdoor temperatures were only in the mid 60's during the day and down to the low 40's at night, it was a bit of a reverse polar bear plunge experience to drift outside amidst the steam rising from the water into the cool nighttime air. There are a couple of indoor trees that are growing in large planters by the pool, and a small leaf will occasionally fall into the pool. This did not detract from my family's fun experience at all, as it is an easy matter to remove the leaf. Our son had hours of fun in the pool, and we had no reservations with it at all. There is also a fitness center with modern fitness equipment. A $50.00 incidentals fee was authorized against our credit card upon check-in, but it was refunded in full when we checked out. We were blessed to have a parking space practically at the front door of the property, although there is abundant parking to the side and rear of the property. There is no charge for the on-site parking, and a free shuttle service will ferry hotel guests to local attractions including Northpark Mall, the SMU campus, and other sites. All in all, we will definitely stay at this property again in the future if we need another family get-away vacation, and we eagerly recommend the Radisson Hotel Dallas Central - University Park to each of you who read this review. Gerry Szczepanski, the general manager, and Alisha Ryder, the front office supervisor, have done a magnificent job with the property, making it warm and inviting. Each member of the hotel staff was smiling when we encountered him or her in the hallways, at the front desk, or throughout the hotel, and each person seemed genuinely interested in having us as their guests and making our stay wonderful. You will be pleased with your stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: speaker55
Reviews.Content: The heating unit by the window had a sticker reading "thermostat located on the wall". I tried every way possible to turn the heater on and finally called the front desk. She asked me if I wanted maintenance to come up? If...seriously? anyway, the guy who came up inspected the unit and told me that it had never been hocked up to the wall thermostat, so I had to work it from the unit. There was a dried stain on the floor in the shape of water flow that appeared to come from the opposite wall from the bathroom. The room was musty smelling so I just kept my shoes on the whole time. I conducted a seminar there the next morning and had to ask several times to have the coffee and continental breakfast set up. Earnesto on the catering staff tried his hardest to make the morning go well asking several times if there was any thing I needed. He even told me just before I left that someone left a phone on the front table of the conference room. It was MY phone and I don't even want to think of what would have happened if I had left it there!! The airport shuttle was not available when I arrived the night before from the airport so I had to take a taxi costing around $17. When I left the next afternoon the driver was very nice and even waited for me at the end of the day to make a special run to the airport for me as I had been told they would be to busy!. I greatly appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: kimporterfield
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning didn't work. Sleep Number bed was broken. Found hairs in bathtub and sink so obviously not clean. I will never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A hidden find”
Reviews.Author: akgirl49
Reviews.Content: We were only in Dallas for a layover before driving to Houston so spent a very short time at the Radisson. Turned out to be a hidden gem for us because it was not economical in terms of $$, but very well located to the stores we were interested in frequenting (a West Elm is within walking distance and a Whole Foods Market a short drive), plus easy distance/drive to Morton's Steakhouse. Looks old and rundown on the outside which makes you kind of wonder if you should even risk going inside but once inside it's decent, clean and the staff very friendly and cordial. We opted for the buffet breakfast which was nothing to write home about and never worth the money because we can't eat enough to justify the cost. A fire alarm went off during breakfast so we had to listen to a siren throughout our meal - no one ever told us we needed to exit although the staff went outside and left us sitting there!! Would stay there again for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap / very good location”
Reviews.Author: MarinaBahrain
Reviews.Content: This Radisson is a bit of a dump to be totally honest...but to be fair the rooms are large compared to their expensive and upmarket neighbour the Palomar. The Radisson is also walking distance from SMU and Mockingbird Station. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Love Field and free wireless as well as complimentary Starbucks coffee in the lobby. We found breakfast quite good for 12 $ and the service was very fast and friendly even at 6 in the morning:)) The bathrooms and airco really need upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Dreary Musty and Uncomfortable!”
Reviews.Author: txveggiemama
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed. I have never stayed at a Radisson and probably won't again based on this stay. I had an appt at the spine institute a few miles up and instead of fighting through 40 miles of early morning Dallas rush hour traffic I decided to get this hotel room. I chose this hotel based on the website saying that they had the sleep # bed. We checked in around 9:30 and had a first floor room. Upon turning the corner to our room it had a nasty smell. I opened the door to our room and all I can say was it was Brown, dark brown wall paper everywhere. It had the 1980's quilted polyester bed spread, polyester blanket and ink stains on my bleach smelled sheets and the headboard was chipped everywhere. The drawer to the nightstand was broke and the dresser the tv was on was all chipped up. The only thing updated was the tv. It looked like a picture was missing in the room because there was a huge empty space with hardware sticking out of the wall. Creepier was going to the "window" to find the bar area! Nice, good thing I checked before I opened the curtains while in my pj's. Needless to say loud and could explain the smell. The beds- not sleep #, apparently not all of the beds are sleep #- failed to mention on the site as this was the #1 reason I choose to stay here. Instead I got to wear in the last few springs left in the bed that complete sloped me to the middle- Uncomfortable as could be. All I could say is Thank God this was for one night, it was convenient to what I needed but it looked nothing like the pictures on their website. I would be horrified if we stayed here for a vacation, couldn't imagine a business trip or a romantic trip either. It reminded me of a Super 8 or Motel 6 I would have stayed at 20 years ago as a kid when there wasn't another hotel in sight and we had to pull over to sleep. Yuck- Try the another hotel down Central Expressway- I don't think you could find worse!

Reviews.Title: “Location makes it perfect”
Reviews.Author: BAHAAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so perfectly located if you are visiting SMU. It is an older property that they are trying hard to keep up with the times. Granite bathroom counters and nice bed linens, coffee maker, and good soaps. Nice bar downstairs and breakfast is good. Some of the pillows need to be replaced... Lumpy. If you get those, just ask front desk and they will replace. ( Hotel should go through and dispose of those and upgrade pillows) Staff is VERY nice and helpful! There are fancier hotels nearby but for the money this is good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Sofisticated”
Reviews.Author: design4U
Reviews.Content: The Lobby, bar and restaruant areas have all recently been redone_ Bravo! It is elegant, but not snobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Trevman
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a free shuttle service from Love Field and is almost adjacent to SMU campus. The hotel pool is poor and the bar is empty.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating...A/C loud and awful...hole in roof”
Reviews.Author: john55c
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 week here for business, and was dissapointed with the condition of the hotel. The staff are all friendly, courteous and nice, and try to accomodate, but the A/C is loud, does not get cool, and sounds like water is running. Due to heavy rain, and my room was on the 9th floor, a hole opened in the ceiling in the bathroom. As others in our group had issues with bed bugs, I did not want to move as it was during my last night there. Sleep comfort bed left a lot to be desired...glorified air mattress. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone, although the food was decent for the few dinners we had there. The shuttle was convenient, and easy and safe walk to many good places to eat, etc.

Reviews.Title: “NOT enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: herewego84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for its location. What a mistake! Needs a MAJOR overhaul! Ceiling tiles falling out, Sleep Number bed busted with one side ultra-soft and other side ultra-hard, room AC loud and hard to regulate, hot/cold faucets in bath reversed. Skip this one. Too many others to choose from nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Filthy, Rude....not a fun experience!”
Reviews.Author: tashlakai
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE! Manager was RUDE. Shuttle driver refused to take us anywhere, probably because there were always cabs outside. Pool was filthy with garbage floating in it. There were dried boogers on the shower walls. Beds were really uncomfortable and one was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, worth it for the right price.”
Reviews.Author: Bob90024
Reviews.Content: Well as the previous reviews indicate this hotel is fairly old. However, it's location is fantastic (if this is the part of town you need to be in) and it has some practical advantages like ample free self parking, free internet and free shuttle. The main problems to its age are the dated decor, small bathrooms, and window unit HVAC units. The HVAC unit in my room is very loud and when it starts up it's very annoying, that's probably the biggest problem and probably why I wouldn't recommend staying here if you're a light sleeper (unless it's during the spring/fall and you don't need it). The carpet is dark so it's hard to know if it's clean or not, but overall the room seems perfectly clean for its age, the daily housekeeping service did a good job keeping the bathroom clean and plenty of fresh towels. The bathroom is very small but it has some recent upgrades such as a granite countertop and a curved shower curtain (the curtain looked brand new). The room has a tube TV, I haven't seen one of those in at least 5 years (not even a flat front tube, it's curved). For what I was looking for, good price, this location, free internet, free parking, this was a good choice. If the AC wasn't so loud it would have been a 4 rating for me, but the loud AC is pretty bad so I have to bump it down to a 3. It may be becuase of my room location but the internet is crazy fast. The other reviews are pretty harsh, you get what you pay for, I wouldn't pay over $130 for it though. For those that booked via a third party, I never book via third party sites, the hotel's own site will always have the best price and 100% of your money goes to the hotel so they will treat you like their client, not like the third party's client.

Reviews.Title: “'Technicalities' ruined what would have been a wonderful weekend for our organization.”
Reviews.Author: ArtyKels
Reviews.Content: I'm an executive for a student organization at my university, and I chose to book this hotel because the amenities and location were perfectly suited to our needs. I booked through a third-party website, understanding that there could be some complications. I requested two rooms with two double beds each, enough for the seven people attending. When we arrived we were given two rooms with one double bed each, due to 'high traffic'. They were also out of cots for the same reason, leaving three members without a place to sleep. They had to find alternate accommodations. We were told that since we did not book directly with the hotel, we were given lowest priority, even though we prepaid and booked well in advance. The rooms were average, but very outdated. The TVs especially are very old, and ours exploded while we were trying to change the channel. Literally. Three members decided to have breakfast at the hotel the next morning and paid a whopping $40 for a sub-par breakfast buffet. I was told to come back at noon to try and book another room for the next night, so I left the other members in the Arts District and came back, only to be turned away for another two and a half hours. I was constantly having to leave the group throughout the day because the Radisson said I had to book in person and could not conduct any of this over the phone. I was distracted the whole day and couldn't lead the group like I had planned. When we did get a new room the bedding was dirty, we were missing towels and the sleep number beds they gave us as a 'courtesy' did not work. This should have been a fun weekend and bonding experience for the members of our organization, but these 'technicalities' split the organization between two hotels and put everyone on edge because plans weren't fleshed out. The location is convenient and the accommodations are average, but you can find much better for less. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe this hotel is still in business..”
Reviews.Author: Boxster126
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at plenty of Radisson's in the past without a problem, but this place was just a disaster! I'm not even sure where to start. The rooms are dark, outdated, and small. The room I stayed in was so drafty that the LOUD heater was running pretty much 24/7. The thermostat had a mind of it's own, so I could set it to 74 degrees, and come back an hour later to find it 68 degrees. The room hadn't been vacuumed in awhile. Someone left some hair clips on the floor, and in the 4 days I was there, no one picked them up. Someone else's hair was on the bathroom counter. The sink's stopper was broken, so you couldn't easily shave. The tub was peeling and generally disgusting. The Sleep Number bed was uncomfortable. The list just goes on and on. The restaurant food was pretty average, especially for the prices they charged. I was with a party of 30 (each with their own room), and it was a huge disaster for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expect”
Reviews.Author: y2000k
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on a Priceline bid and were rather concerned due to the numerous negative reviews. We stayed only 1 night and it was not bad. The staff at reception was courteous. Our room is fine - bathroom & decor are a bit dated but acceptable otherwise. One issue is noise from the Central Expressway; sort of a white noise but can be a problem if you are used to quiet environments. Also, our room faces South. Even on this late Oct day, the room was quite warm. I cannot imagine how hot it gets in the summer. Free wi-fi worked fine in our room.

Reviews.Title: “From an APWG Member with thanks”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights recently while attending a workshop at SMU with about 200 colleagues. We stayed at the Radisson and also ate some buffet dinners here. I was VERY happy and delighted with the service we received from staff. Alicia on the front desk is a star! Also, the complimentary shuttle was very handy - the guys drove us to campus, and up to NorthPark whenever we asked. WiFi worked fine for me. But there don't appear to be any safes, which is a security issue for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Internet Service in Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctacoma
Reviews.Content: I checked the reviews on this hotel before making a reservation and noticed some bad reviews having to do with internet service and other things. Having stayed here a few times in the past and always having good experiences I went ahead and made a reservation and checked in on Friday afternoon. Shortly after checking in I was able to use the wireless internet connection in my room to logon but then a couple of hours later I had no connection. Called the front desk and was told the internet service was down and they didn't know when it would be up again. Well, I checked out Sunday morning and there was still no internet service. Also no service in their "business center". From my past experiences and current observations, I believe this hotel has changed ownership and the service and facility will continue to go downhill.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised...Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGurl80
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel after reading some of the iffy reviews. But I was definitely pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful from the time that I checked in, to the time that I checked out. The hotel is in a great location in downtown Dallas. Very close to plenty of shopping and dining. They have a really nice restaurant set-up there as well. I also loved the complimentary copies of â€œFDâ€� (fashion) magazine that the hotel offered. The room was a very nice size with great decor. I had a room with a king size bed, a good size desk, as well as a cozy chair with a foot stool. The room was very clean and comfortable. My only complaints would be that the window air conditioner unit was very loud. Also, I could tell that the bathroom had been remodeled (very nicely) but it looked like the shower and bathtub was refurbished instead of replaced, still, they were both very clean. All in all, the Radisson is a great place to stayâ€¦especially for the price! I will be staying there again on my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Full of false promises”
Reviews.Author: STEMIAN
Reviews.Content: A group of 15 teachers from all over Texas stayed last week at this hotel due to their partnership with SMU, host of a week long training. We were assigned homework on a daily basis to be completed online. One of the sale points of this hotel is free wi-fi in the room, which was not provided at all, not even in any part of the hotel. Their business center consisted of two computers and a printer, at first one computer was working (no internet) , but after the first day none worked. Needless to say were not able to accomplish assignments and have to work either from a Starbucks or other business who would provide the service. I called the front desk to inquire about the status of the service Wednesday (midway of my stay) and Veronica in the front desk transferred my call to a brokerage firm, who in turn were extremely upset as I was not the only call she had transferred in error to them. I later called the corporate office and a manager offered to shuttle us to another hotel to use their lobby for their wi-fi connection or if it was to check email to use the front desk computer. Which obviously was something unacceptable for the purpose of our stay. A transfer to another hotel with the service would have worked wonders... The university provided us with breakfast vouchers for their restaurant, the first day they served buffet breakfast which was right on the dot with the voucher value. The next four days we were given a menu, with pricing that was near impossible to keep below voucher value. For sure, this is not the hotel to stay in Dallas!
